Next.js is running 14 now 15 will also come, maybe 21 will also come The concept will be the same, the syntax can be slightly different So now I have made it into JavaScript and what I will do here I what I will do I will say blog post slash and I will make slug here like this and slash page.js so see what I did here slash slug this slug is a variable I have written it in square bracket so what I js so it will give me js if I say python so it will give me python which means I can access a variable from my url in the page then what I can do here I can fetch from the database fetch your blog by slug so I can do this kind of work if I am using dynamic routes now assume I have to make 50 blog posts suppose I have 50 blog posts in my database one on python, one on java, one on javascript and so on so will I make routes one by one no, I will make dynamic routes I will say a variable will come after blog post what will that variable be that will be known here so I will write here slash blog post slash python and python will be available in my page I can say that if python is not there or if it is not from 5-6 languages suppose I have an array of languages I am saying let languages is equal to python and I have javascript c, c sharp all languages are available I will say if I will say languages.includes params.slug then what I can do then return it otherwise you will say post not found so it can be python, javascript java, cpp or c sharp I will say cpp and cs if I write cs suppose this is available in my database then my post will be cs if I write harry then post not found so
